CatDescriptText: Cutline of related article published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, February 5, 1944, pg. 17 reads: "Shown above are Mrs. Bill (Bojangles) Robinson, left, and the inimitable Bojangles, who were quietly married in Columbus, Ohio, last Thursday. They were united by the Rev. H.N. Robinson, pastor of St. Paul church, Columbus, in home of Dr. Lloyd L. Jones.  Mayor J. H. Rhodes of the Ohio Capital, was the first to congratulate the famous 65-year-young dancer.  Bojangles' wife, the former Miss Elaine Plaines, of Brooklyn, N.Y., is 25..."
TitMainTitle: Bill Bojangles Robinson dancing with his wife Elaine Plaines Robinson, backstage at the Stanley Theatre
